name: Robert Grosseteste
summary: Robert Grosseteste was Bishop of Lincoln from 1235 to 1253 and one of the most learned men of the Middle Ages. He was a philosopher, theologian, scientist, and administrator. As bishop, he worked to reform the clergy and defend the rights of the Church. He translated works from Greek and Arabic and made important contributions to optics and natural philosophy. He was an early proponent of experimental science and mathematical approaches to understanding nature.
